result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean G. Rooney

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:36 AM: Defendant Sean G. Rooney in court. Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Sean G. Rooney. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Clarification of the amended information by the DE. Recess for the parties to talk. Case recalled @ 10:48 AM, same appearances. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment. Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained. Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Counts 2 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Count 1 - Dismissed with Prejudice. No statement by the DE. Court orders: S/W - 1 year probation. Conditions: Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with I.S. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Attorney Fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
LETC dated 10-21-22 to DE re: non payment of attorney fees. se

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

LETC dated 9-9-22 to DE re: non payment of attorney fees. se

Case called @ 1:50 PM Defendant Sean G. Rooney in court.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Sean G. Rooney.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Deputy Matthew Elliot sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by ADA Kottke. Witness identifies the defendant. Exhibit 1 marked. Witness testifies to exhibit 1. ADA Kottke offers exhibit 1. No objection by Atty Sheets. The Court receives exhibit 1. Cross exam by Atty Sheets. Re-direct by ADA Kottke. Re-cross by Atty Sheets. Witness excused. The Court finds probable cause. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant must pay $250 deposit by 5/13/2022 then $100 monthly starting 06/01/2022 for court appointed counsel.

Case called @ 1:33 PM Defendant Sean G. Rooney in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant requests counsel - referred to SPD. Defendant must pay $250 deposit then $100 monthly starting May 1, 2022 for court appointed counsel if not eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. No statement by DE regarding bond.
